title: Guia do Usuário do Extrator CD2030
Guia do Usuário do Extrator CD2030
section: Visão Geral da Iniciativa Countdown to 2030
text:
Visão Geral da Iniciativa Countdown to 2030
A iniciativa Countdown to 2030 para a Saúde da Mulher, da Criança e do Adolescente (The Countdown) é uma colaboração global que envolve académicos de instituições nacionais, regionais e internacionais, agências da ONU, o Banco Mundial e organizações da sociedade civil. A iniciativa acompanha o progresso na Saúde e Nutrição Reprodutiva, Materna, Neonatal, Infantil e do Adolescente (RMNCAH+N), promovendo a advocacia e a responsabilização através de uma análise rigorosa de dados.
Os principais objetivos incluem:

Fortalecer a análise e o monitoramento de dados liderados pelos países
Promover a inovação e a geração de evidências através da colaboração multinacional
Aprimorar a medição e o monitoramento global
Melhorar a comunicação de políticas e programas

Para mais informações sobre a iniciativa Countdown to 2030, visite: O site The Countdown

title: Guia do Usuário do Extrator CD2030
text:
Sobre o pacote R cd2030.extractor
O aplicativo Shiny cd2030.extractor foi desenvolvido para facilitar o download de dados do Countdown diretamente a partir do DHIS2.
É compatível com instâncias do DHIS2 em todos os países suportados.
O código-fonte está disponível no GitHub:
https://github.com/aphrcwaro/extractor_guide
A documentação completa está disponível em:
https://aphrcwaro.github.io/extractor_guide/

Principais funcionalidades

Interface intuitiva para seleção e gerenciamento de dados

Exportação dos dados no formato padrão do Countdown, pronto para análise e geração de relatórios

title: 1  Getting started
text:
1.1 Software requirements
The tool simplifies the process of downloading country DHIS2 data, transforming it into a standardized Countdown format. It supports the mapping of country-specific RMNCAH indicators, which enhances data standardization and portability.
To use this innovative digital health analytics tool, the following are required:

title: 1  Getting started
text:
Install the latest versions of R and RStudio
Install RTools (for Windows users, to support package compilation)
Install the cd2030.extractor R package latest version-noted by the superscript suffix in the name of the App

title: 1  Getting started
text:
1.2 Installing R and RStudio
To begin working in R, it is necessary to install both R and RStudio. R is the underlying programming language, while RStudio provides a user-friendly interface that simplifies the development and execution of R scripts. Both are freely available and widely supported across platforms.
Note: R and RStudio are not the same. R is the programming language, while RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) that makes working with R easier.
To ensure smooth installation and functionality, it is recommended to install R first, followed by RStudio. This order is important as RStudio relies on R to function properly.

1.2.1 Step 1: Download and Install R
R is distributed via The Comprehensive R Archive Network (CRAN). Select your operating system from the homepage: Windows, Mac, or Linux.
Windows

Navigate to Download R for Windows and select the “base” option.
Click the first link (e.g., “Download R x.x.x for Windows”) to download the installer.
Run the installer and follow the prompts. Administrator privileges may be required.
R will be installed in your system’s Program Files, with a shortcut added to the Start menu.

Mac

Click Download R for Mac on the CRAN homepage.
Download the latest release package and run the installer.
The default installation settings are typically sufficient. You may be prompted to enter your system password.

Note
R is not a graphical software application but a programming environment. It is best used in conjunction with RStudio, which provides a consistent and user-friendly interface across operating systems.


1.2.2 Step 2: Download and Install RStudio
RStudio is an integrated development environment (IDE) designed for R. It features a script editor, console, graphics viewer, and additional tools for package management, debugging, and file organization.
Download RStudio from Posit Website
Do I still need to download R? Even if you use RStudio, you’ll still need to download R to your computer. RStudio helps you use the version of R that lives on your computer, but it doesn’t come with a version of R on its own.
After installation, launch RStudio and begin interacting with R through its console and script windows.

title: 1  Getting started
text:
1.3 Installing the CD2030 Extractor package
After installing R and RStudio, you may proceed with installing the Countdown 2030 Extractor application, which is hosted on GitHub under the repository cd2030.extractor. The application is implemented as an R package and supports interactive dashboard generation via Shiny.

1.3.1 Installation via R Console

if (!requireNamespace("devtools", quietly = TRUE)) install.packages("devtools")
devtools::install_github("aphrcwaro/dhis2")



1.3.2 Launching the Application

library(cd2030.extractor)
run_app()

The Shiny dashboard will launch automatically in your default web browser.











1.3.3 Alternative Installation via GitHub Desktop or Git or direct download
Advanced users with GitHub accounts may prefer to clone the repository directly. This method allows for:

Version control
Contribution to the codebase
Inspection of the package structure
Once cloned, open the .Rproj file in RStudio to set the working directory.
























To install and run:

devtools::load_all()
run_app()



1.3.4 RTools for Windows
To compile packages from source, especially development versions, RTools must be installed. Ensure the Rtools selected corresponds and is compatibile with your installed R version.:

R 4.2.0 → Rtools42
R 4.4.0 → Rtools44
R 4.5.0 → Rtools45

Rtools can be downloaded from CRAN

title: 2  App Features
text:
2.1 Overview
This cd2030.extractor app has three main sections
Understanding these sections helps you select, filter, and extract DHIS2 data efficiently.

title: 2  App Features
text:
Top Navigation Bar (Green Header)
Sidebar (Data Controls on the left)
Main Panel (Central Content area)

title: 2  App Features
text:
2.2 Top Navigation Bar
The Navigation Bar spans the top of the app. It include:

Three navigation tabs: Service Data, Population Data and Countdown Data.
User identity and country displayedOn the right side
If logged in via a custom URL, the base URL appears instead of the country name


2.2.1 Service Data Tab:
Use this tab to retrieve monthly service data.

Select data elements from DHIS2
Filter by period, organisation level, or unit
View and download structured data tables












2.2.2 Population Data Tab
Used for downloading population data or other yearly indicators.

Allows selection of elements organized by year
Functions similarly to Service Data but on an annual scale












2.2.3 Countdown Tab
Enables extraction of Countdown indicators.

Maps DHIS2 data elements to Countdown indicators
Downloads mapped data and structure for portability
Exports Excel file preformatted for Countdown data analysis












2.2.4 Context Information
Located on the top-right.

Shows logged-in username
Displays selected country
If using a custom DHIS2 instance, shows the instance URL instead
Has a log-out button to clear the credentials

title: 2  App Features
text:
2.3 Sidebar
Found on the left side of the screen, the sidebar lets you define what data to retrieve.

2.3.1 Components:

Data Level Choose the administrative level (e.g., County or Sub-County) This selection determines what the Countdown tab treats as administrative level 2
Filter by Data Level Optionally filter to a specific unit or multiple units at the selected level
Data Period Select the date range for which to retrieve data Uses a start and end date calendar picker
